data.title: This Week In 1958 The Flying V Guitar Was Born
data.meta_description: This Week In 1958 The Flying V Guitar Was Born Introduced in 1958—the Gibson Flying V Guitar. Gibson was trying to find the right guitar
data.text:
Introduced in 1958—the Gibson Flying V Guitar. Gibson was trying to find the right guitar design to compete with the popular competitor Fender and their Stratocaster guitar.

Famous Rock And Blues Players Took Notice

Dave Davies from the Kinks, guitar great Lonnie Mack, and blues legends like Albert King started playing the Gibson Flying V Guitars. The guitar started to become more and more popular. Today the 1958–59 Flying V is worth between US$200,000 and US$250,000.

Are the Gibson Flying V Guitars Being Made Today?

Both Gibson and Epiphone make a 1958-style Flying V, designed to look like the original. Gibson has discontinued the guitar off and on over the years. Also have come up with unique upgrades in designs. High-performance limited edition runs of this brand for different markets around the world.

Check out more on the Gibson website here

Did You Know The Original Factory Was In Michigan?

Gibson Guitars, founded in Kalamazoo in 1894 It started as Orville Gibson’s part-time hobby! He worked to fund his true passion – handcrafting musical instruments. Some of the greatest guitars came out of the factory.

In 1950, a man named Ted McCarty took over the presidency of Gibson, and under his stewardship Gibson developed the P-90 pickup, the ES-175, the first triple pickup electric guitar. The Gibson Les Paul. and so many more.

What Great Guitar Players Play a Flying V Guitar?

Flying Vs later became a popular heavy metal, were used by guitarists Paul Stanley, Rudolf Schenker, Andy Powell, Michael Schenker, K. K. Downing, James Hetfield, Kirk Hammett, Lenny Kravits, Dave Davies, Zakk Wylde and Dave Mustaine.

The Gibson Flying V Has Even Made Its Mark In The Movies

A 1958 Flying V in “This is Spinal Tap“, played by actor Christopher Guest, who played Nigel Tufnel. The movie has a huge cult following.

The Original Gibson Factory In Kalamazoo, Michigan Is Still Making Guitars…, …Just under a different name

Back in the 80’s Gibson moved all of their production from their original factory in Kalamazoo, Michigan, to their other factory in Tennessee. Many of the original workers didn’t want to relocate, so they bought all the old equipment from Gibson and began making their own guitars, under the name “Heritage Guitars” Check out their website.

Heritage Guitars

Happy 66th Anniversary to the Gibson Flying V Guitar from Kalamazoo Michigan

Rock Hall Fan Vote 2024: Voting Ends Early, Final Standings

Born in Mt Clemens, Screamin’ Scott has been a part of the Detroit airwaves for 30-plus years. With 40 years of experience in radio. When he’s not out on the streets for WCSX, you can find him devoting time to local charities with his, “Screamin Angels”; and for 16 years with Rock 4 Tots charity. And last 10 years with his local band, "Chit!." Screamin Scott likes to write about nostalgic Detroit area memories, classic rock, and local metro Detroit topics.
